free_text.Form of examination: Continuous assessment, 2 tests per semester[br/]Each control counts for 25% of the final grading
free_text.Bibliography and material: Polycopié[br/]C. Delannoy, Programmer en Langage C, Eyrolles
free_text.Content: [br/][li]	Introduction to the programming environment Visual C++[br/][li]	Program structure[br/][li]	Declarations and statements[br/][li]	Basic data types[br/][li]	Operators and expressions[br/][li]	Interactive input/output[br/][li]	Control structures[br/][li]	Arrays[br/][li]	Pointers[br/][li]	Functions[br/][br/]Training by means of the programming of simple examples in the frame of exercices on computer.[br/]
free_text.Type of teaching: Ex cathedra, practical work on computer
free_text.Learning outcomes: To gain the basic concepts of programming.[br/]To know a programming environment (Visual C++).[br/]To be able to implement the solution of a simple numerical problem in a program written in C.
